author: Bill Gaydon
comment: Typifies Chicago, semi-functional.

author: ronald andre
comment: Not great, I could read in portrait or landscape but now ONLY IN PORTRAIT ON MY TABLET which is annoying

author: Lauren Kottis
comment: Hate that I can't see/write comments through the app

author: Ken Crost
comment: Very slow and buggy. Might be one of the worst apps I use.

author: John Galobich
comment: I can not view this app in lanscape. A real problem.

author: Snuggs28 Bob L
comment: I have a subsription.  And this,freaking site keeps giving me the trial window after I keep logging in.  Plus the app is SLOW!!!!!

author: Daniel Stralka
comment: Very functional, but nothing extra special about it.

author: T. Grant
comment: Only news app on my tablet which can't be viewed in portrait.

author: toby mac
comment: Nice to be caught up with hometown news
Junk

The content is good and, as a native Chicagoan, I'll always read the Tribune, but the auto-start videos have got to go. Not only are they annoying and disruptive, they also make your app a huge data hog. Please let me decide if I want to watch the video by tapping on it or opting in for auto-starts. Please stop!

author: Karen Nothacker
comment: I love the Chicago Tribune and the app,  but I would appreciate it if the app would clear the alerts after being read. I find it very annoying to have already read alerts "stored" under the "bell" on the home page. If I have read the alerts, why store it in another place??

author: Michael Skiles
comment: The Tribune content is great, but this app leaves a lot to be desired.  It crashes a lot, there are plenty of quirky bugs, and the scrolling feels bad.  Many articles have auto playing videos which is already a big no-no, but the stop button is infuriatingly hard to press.  They ought to take a few lessons from the New York Times app.

author: Kate Guarna
comment: I love the content, but this app is really buggy. Lots of crashes and issues with video content.

author: Rick Martinez
comment: Can't log in because they removed the ability to log in using Google. My paying account is useless now.

author: Ray Cebold
comment: Not user friendly. Connections frequently drop. Video performance is terrible.

author: Kyle Hall
comment: This app desperately needs landscape mode on tablets.

author: Ki K
comment: I love that I am able to access my digital subscription and save articles.  The app is very user friendly.

author: Keith Pain
comment: Unstable app.  Disorganized layout.

author: Tom Potter
comment: Add landscape mode.

author: Bruce Erickson
comment: Portrait mode only? Frequent reboots? Pop-up ads for subscribers? Subscribers no longer able to open eNewspaper articles? I repeat, subscribers no longer able to open eNewspaper articles (11/19/17 while travelling)? What's the point in subscribing if you can't read the actual paper? Absolutely SUCKS!

author: Stephen Czyz
comment: Recent update (October) locked all the stories into portrait mode. On a tablet, that's bad. Please fix, ASAP. Till then, 2 stars at best.

author: Sang Kim
comment: Keep rebooting. Like how they've integrated the epaper version with the Tribune app.

author: Di'Kobie Berry
comment: It's kind of hard to log in to your account via google, when there isn't a google button or interface availible.

author: Tom Banghart
comment: I enjoy the stories are updated frequently.   I don't have any technical problems.  And the reporting is good.  Overall organization is fine. I subscribe to the paper version as well, and they're complimentary.

author: Jack Brooks
comment: Freezes and shuts down frequently

author: Matthew Mayer
comment: Auto play video that forces orientation change, lots of force closes

author: Jon Beard
comment: Portrait mode is horrible

author: Bill Tarsitano
comment: Very precise

author: Allen Peoples
comment: Loading...loading... I would have uninstalled this thing right away if it weren't my local paper. I get almost all my news from The Guardian.  Now with a later version the loading was okay for a while, now pretty slow again, and it likes to forget I'm a subscriber!

author: Dan Czajka
comment: App not working properly. I've subscribed to New App for at least a year and now I am unable to access all of the stories. Customer Service is saying that 4.99 per month gets you 5 articles. If that's the case, I will cancel this service.

author: Laura Kenward
comment: I turned off sports notifications because I only want real news but it pushes sports notifications every couple of hours. Otherwise, it's clean and easy to use.

author: Mary Jo Wildman
comment: I really like the old version where I can open the app to a full newspaper, flip the pages as if I'm reading the paper paper. I like being able enlarge the article on that page instead of the current version this app utilizes.

author: Jeff Parnell
comment: I am a Tribune subscriber, every article has a pop up advertisement.

author: Mark Krempl
comment: Work well for what it does

author: Brandon Meng
comment: Why is it that I have to use this instead of the red-eye app. You should've left that app alone, as it's difficult to find the red-eye articles now.  This app does not load and is incredibly boring to look at. Idk how tronc can claim to be web-first when their app is so far behind the competition.  I assume the developers are doing the best they can with the tools provided, so management needs to recognize that this is not complete yet.

author: Dean Skora
comment: Bad performance in paid mode, too limited in free. Stories will not scroll until ads load, and ads take far too long; links frequently don't launch; app crashes far too often for a basic, no-frills news reader (again, the ads). If this is "new media" Tronc, they don't have the tech down yet.

author: Mary Nash-Pyott
comment: seamless for me, and i'm rural with spotty networks. No stuttering, no intrusive pop-ups so far. Not sure what is happening to other subscribers, to see intrusive ads. Maybe they changed that since?

author: Christine O'Connor
comment: This app often freezes forcing me to exit and start over. I also wish the comments were accessible through the app.

author: John Coleman
comment: Website pushes too much advertising even to subscribers. User experience is terrible because of the intrusive pop ups and loading time. Just awful.
